member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormat
member.summary: Describes the kind of data to be formatted.
member.remarks: Other flags are only for use with when applied to properties.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormat.Default
member.summary: Data is formatted (with no privacy) using the type's standard or overridden `ToString()` method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormat.Text
member.summary: Text is hashed when privacy is enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormat.Path
member.summary: File name or file path is partially hashed when privacy is enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormat.Email
member.summary: Email address is partially hashed when privacy is enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormat.Uri
member.summary: URI is partially hashed when privacy is enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormat.Token
member.summary: Tokens are never formatted, regardless of whether privacy is enabled. Instead they are replaced by a placeholder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormat.Omit
member.summary: Indicates a property should always be omitted from a formatted object, regardless of whether privacy is enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormat.OmitDefault
member.summary: Indicates a property should be omitted from a formatted object if the value is null or the default value for the type, rather than included as "Name=null". Can be combined with other format flags.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormat.Hide
member.summary: Indicates a property should be omitted from a formatted object when privacy is enabled. Can be combined with other format flags.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormat.SingleMember
member.summary: An object that normally has a single non-null member value is formatted in a more-compact form.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormatAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a class or property should be formatted in a specific way by a live share format provider instance.
member.remarks: Use when `DataContract` and `DataMember` attributes are not used or do not provide sufficient formatting hints.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormatAttribute.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the kind of data represented by the property, for purposes of data formatting and hashing.
member.remarks: Not valid for use on a class attribute.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormatter
member.summary: Supports formatting various fields for logging purposes, including optional hashing of potentially sensitive information to protect privacy.
member.remarks:
This class implements `IFormatProvider`, so an instance can be passed as the first parameter to `String.Format()`. For example this line: String.Format(new DataFormatter(), "{0:P}", filePath); will use the `DataFormatter` to hash the file path when formatting it.
Use an instance of this class as the format provider for a class that extends `TraceListenerBase` to enable smart formatting of traced data objects.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormatter.Debug
member.summary: Format string suitable for use with DebuggerDisplayAttribute, for example: [DebuggerDisplay(DataFormatter.Debug)]

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormatter.RegisterFormat(System.Type,Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormat)
member.summary: Registers a format for a data contract class. Equivalent to applying a `[DataFormat]` attribute to the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormatter.RegisterFormat(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo,Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormat)
member.summary: Registers a format for a property. Equivalent to applying a `[DataFormat]` attribute to the property.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.DataFormatter.Format(System.Object)
member.summary: Formats an object using the object's default format.
member.remarks: This static method does NOT use hashing, regardless of any instance setting.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Privacy
member.summary: Manages a key used to hash sensitive data to ensure privacy.
member.remarks: Once generated (or set by a client), the key is stored in .NET isolated storage, so that it remains consistent across sessions. The key does not need to be stored in a secure vault because it is only used as an HMAC key for hashing the current user's data for tracing and telemetry; the hashed data is then uploaded without the key.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Privacy.Key
member.summary: Gets the key, generating it if not found in storage, or sets the key and stores it for later use.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Tracing.ConsoleTraceListener
member.summary: Writes trace events to stdout.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Tracing.LogFileTraceListener
member.summary: Writes trace events (with basic metadata) to a log file in the temp directory.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Tracing.SourceLevelsFilter
member.summary: Enables filtering based on a combination of trace source name and trace level.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Tracing.SourceLevelsFilter.#ctor(System.Diagnostics.SourceLevels,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.String,System.Diagnostics.SourceLevels},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Creates a new filter with a default level and optional specific levels for certain sources.
member.param: Default levels to be traced, for sources for which no specific levels are specified.
Optional mapping from source names to trace levels, to use non-default levels for specific components.
Optional enumeration of event ids that go to console unfiltered, ignoring console verbosity.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Tracing.TraceFormat.ParseEventId(System.String)
member.summary: Parses trace output to extract an event id associated with the message.
member.returns: Event ID or null if the line doesn't match expected pattern

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Tracing.TraceSourceExtensions
member.summary: Convenience methods for TraceSource.TraceEvent().
member.remarks: Methods that take format arguments or (dollar-prefixed) interpolated strings delay the formatting of arguments until the trace event is actually consumed by a trace listener (assuming it's not ignored by a trace filter).

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Tracing.TraceSourceExtensions.WithName(System.Diagnostics.TraceSource,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new TraceSource with listeners and switch copied from the existing TraceSource.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Tracing.TraceSourceExtensions.WithAppendName(System.Diagnostics.TraceSource,System.String)
member.summary: Return a new TraceSource by appending a name

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Tracing.TraceSourceExtensions.ListensFor(System.Diagnostics.TraceSource,System.Diagnostics.TraceEventType)
member.summary: Returns true if there is at least one listener that will consume this trace event type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Tracing.TraceSourceExtensions.NonFormattableString
member.summary: Work around an overload resolution problem with `FormattableString`, enabling interpolated string to be used with tracing efficiently while also supporting plain strings.
member.remarks:
See Overloaded string methods with string interpolation.
An extra implicit conversion causes the compiler to prefer the overloads that take `FormattableString` when interpolated strings are used with the tracing methods. While plain `string` parameters get converted to/from this struct, the conversions should basically evaporate in inlining.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Tracing.TracingHttpMessageHandler
member.summary: Write HTTP request and response details to a trace source.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Tracing.TracingHttpMessageHandler.TraceHeaders
member.summary: True to turn on tracing of request and response headers. Off by default.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.Tracing.TracingHttpMessageHandler.TraceContent
member.summary: True trace request and response body content. Off by default.
member.remarks: Note trace listeners may truncate tracing messages to some reasonable length.
